Method Detail

addToolBarElements

protected int addToolBarElements(javax.swing.JToolBar panelToolbar,
                                 ScanPanel.Location loc,
                                 int x)
Description copied from class: ScanPanel
Adds elements to the toolbar. The method is called while initializing the ScanPanel, at the points specified by the ScanPanel.Location enumeration. Should be overridden by all subclasses that want to add new elements to the ScanPanel's toolbar.

The toolbar is initialized with a GridLayout, so elements have to be added with a GridBagLayout. For this, the getGBC() methods can be used. The gridX parameter specifies the cell (as used in GridLayoutBag.gridx) of the current row where the elements can be added.

The method returns the new coordinates of the current cell, after the elements have been added. Typically, it's value is code + number_of_elements_added.

Overrides:
addToolBarElements in class ScanPanel
Parameters:
panelToolbar - the toolbar
loc - the current location where elements can be added
x - the x coordinates of the current cell in the GridBagLayout
Returns:
the new coordinates of the current cell, after the elements have been added.
